metadata.title: CVE-2019-13724 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Out of bounds memory access in WebBluetooth in Google Chrome prior to78.0.3904.108 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the rendererprocess to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13724` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
